climbs.name: Witchy Way
climbs.fa: Paul Anikis, Eric Janoscrat, Howard Doyle 1982

content.description: Climb a large pedestal up the light colored face.  Follow the overhanging crack to the roof.  Pull the roof on its right side.
content.protection: The protection is good, but difficult to place
content.location: Use the same start as GOOD MORNING.

content.description: Start at a small tree on a tiny ledge formed by the base of a right-faced flake./this climb is just left of the obvious finger crack of Discrepancy and 15 feet right of Membranes.  Pitch 1 climb the thin crack system.  Trend right a top to merge withthe more obvious Discrepancy.
content.protection: Trad

climbs.name: Wapsuck Direct
climbs.fa: Eric Janoscrat, Jim McAtee, Bill Lepro 1978

content.description: Climb the face to the right of the corner, intersecting the route at its midpoint.

climbs.name: WAPSUCK  4
climbs.fa: Eric Janoscrat, Jim McAtee, Bill Lepro 1978

content.description: Ascend the right-leaning corner to the top.
content.location: At the far right side of the LOWER SLABS there is  right-leaning, vegetated corner with a dead tree.

content.description: This is really is a high boulder problem.
content.protection: #2 size fists most of the way.
content.location:
This route is the obvious 20 foot hand crack staring you in the face on the left before you arrive at the main area in the Lower Slabs.

To access it easily, walk up to the Scuttle area, then back toward Slab Rat and then take a left to a pedestal.

content.description: From the top of the pointed flake, move up the face for about 8 ft. to a undercling.  Move left and up to a small flakey crack.  Continue up the crack to a small overhang.  Move right and up a small right-facing corner to the top.
content.protection: Protection is somewhat poor and difficult to place.  Take plenty of small wired nuts.
content.location: Start at the second wall to the left of the large right-facing corer.  Begin at a large loose, pointed detached flake which lies only iches from the main wall.

climbs.name: Sunny Down Bulow
climbs.fa: Eric Janoscrat, Howard Doyle, Pannil Jones 1983

content.description: Climb the face just right of the corner.  Move past a bush then traverse right to another right-facing corner.  Move up this corner and around to the right of a thin right-facing flake.  Move straight up, passing the finish of PRAYING MANTLE.
content.location: Traverse right to left under the slabs until past DARK STAR and almost to GOOD MORNING.  Cut back south across a ledge to a ramp.  Climb the ramp to a spacious ledge.  At the left side is a right-facing corner with a tree about 25 ft. up.

content.description: Climb below the small overhang until it's possible to traverse left to the corner. Undercling (it flexes a bit) 15 ft across the face using polished feet. Guidebook says 'Steep, strenuous, continuous, and a little loose at the top."
content.protection: Small TCU's or the like.
content.location: Begin downhill and around the corner from Scuttle.  15-20 feet left of the TIPS detached flake.

content.description: Just left of Summer Breeze.  Thin crack to rooflet on right and then straight up face past one bolt at around 60' to bolted anchor.
content.protection: Normal trad rack.  The gear is adequate, but not great, everywhere on this route.
content.location: Start at Summer Breeze and move five feet left to an inbovious thin crack.  The gear is adequate here but not great.  Follow thin crack until it is possible to traverse right to a small roof.  Pull the small roof and continue up with widely spaced but good gear to the beautiful face with one bolt.  Anchors are on a ledge more or less straight above the bolt.  One 60m rope will get you down.

climbs.name: Snakebite
climbs.fa: Rick Fairtrace, Glenn Thomas, Barbara Bates

content.description: Climb the flake to the right of the tree until it ends.  Move left and climb the wall straight through the small overhangs and up to the pine tree on top.
content.location: Start to the left of GOOD MORNING at a gully angling up and left.  Scramble up to the second tree.

content.description: Climb the left to the pine tree.  Climb straight up a very shallow corner to the roof.  Move right at the roof, then up the corner to the top.
content.location: Start from a ledge about 15 ft. off of the ground and left of a large vegetated left-facing corner.

content.description: Crux is the first 20 feet, marginal gear on 5.6/5.7 climbing, don't fall through this section.
content.protection: Standard Seneca rack.
content.location: Begin 20 ft right of Scuttle.  Climb the face to a small/thin right facing corner.  Climb to an obvious ledge, traverse right to left facing corner and flakes.

content.description: Climb the right side of the buttress, passing a tree about 15 feet on the way up.  Go up a short left facing corner, to a tree. Route is a bit chaussy throughout.  Near the top, either climb to the left of the block or shuttle around to the right side for easier climbing.
content.protection: Standard Seneca rack. Bring a few 48' runners, otherwise there can be a bit of rope drag.
content.location: Route (5.5) is located about 35 feet to the right of Scuttle and up the hill a tad.  Build an anchor below the huge block to avoid rope drag.  Round the corner of the block and walk off on the ledge to the North, passing the top out of Scuttle.

climbs.name: Praying Mantle
climbs.fa: Eric Janoscrat, Howard Doyle, Mark Thesing 1983

content.description: Climb up and slightly right on loose flakes to a short right-facing corner.  Mover up and over the large flake, past a bush, and into right facing corners.  When the corners end, go up and left to the large pine tree.
content.location: Start just Right of SUNNY DOWN BULOW.

content.description: Climb the crack and left-facing corner to the top.
content.location: Begin at the left end of the wall.

content.description: Climb the grungy chimney in the right-facing corner.  Step out right and pull the small overhang.  Continue up the face to the top.
content.location: Use the same start as GOOD MORNING.

climbs.name: Know Fear
climbs.fa: Ed Begoon, Mike Artz, Howard Clark, David Clark 1991

content.description: Climb to the bolt and up to a short right-facing corner.  There is a poor TCU placement in the corner and another bolt near the top.
content.protection: Bolts and Gear, TCU.
content.location: There is a bolt to the right of SENECA SAMURAI, a short distance above the ledge.

climbs.name: It ain't the meat, its the motion
climbs.fa: Rick Fairtrace, Barbara Bates, Cathy Nardini

content.description: Climb the left side of the corner using cracks and the narrow chimney with chock stones.
content.location: Begin around the corner from TIPS at a right-facig corner.

content.description:
Begin up the ramp on the left side of the corner that "R2D2" is located in for about 15 feet and then step left around the corner to clip the first bolt on the face. Go up through 2 more tightly spaced bolts (crux) dancing between the corner and the face. The route then lets up significantly in difficulty, offering positive holds and high feet through 5 more bolts to a 2 bolt anchor. Lower off through quicklinks.

You can avoid the crux by moving about 5 feet to the right of the arete around the 2nd to 3rd bolt. Move back left to rejoin the line to top.  This lowers the grade to about 5.9.

Can be TR'ed from the bolts.
content.protection: 8 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor
content.location: The bolt line that hugs the arete right of "seldom seen" and left of "R2D2"

climbs.name: Guillotine
climbs.fa: Eric Janoscrat, Howard Doyle, Lori Larsen, Mark Thesing 1983

content.description: Climb the flake and short corner.  At the end of the corner move left to right facing corners.  Climb up the gaping guillotine shaped rock in the overlap.  Climb the left side of the rock and then up right on flakes.  Traverse right to a small pine.
content.protection: The protection is difficult and the rock is bad.
content.location: Start right of PRAYING MANTLE on the same ledge at a pine tree.

content.description: Climb on thin edges past the three bolts and up to the placements for small to medium camming gear.  Pull the bulge and continue up easier ground to a tree.
content.protection: Bolts and Cams.
content.location: Fifteen feet right of KNOWN FEAR and 20 ft. left of the vegetated corner, find three bolts on the face to a left-arching seam.

content.description: Climb the short hand-to- finger crack up the right facing corner.  Feels much easier than other Seneca 5.8's.
content.protection: Standard Seneca rack
content.location: This route is the large right facing corner on the detached cliff directly in front of the Discrepancy wall.  Start on the obvious ramp to reach the corner, climb corner to the end.  When you top out you will be staring at the Discrepancy finger crack. Walk off.  Please tread carefully at the base of all lower slab bc of erosion.

content.description: Climb the flake.  Move up about 40 ft. to the end of the crack.  Continue up  blocky, lichen-covered face.  Turn the corner and finish by mantling a vegetated ledge. (45 ft)
content.location: Start about 15 ft. left of WAPSUCK at the obvious layback flake.

content.description: Move up the corner, past overhanging flakes.  Pull the overhang, then continue past a short chimney to a large tree at the top.
content.location: Begin at the huge, obvious right-facing corner in the middle of the cliff.  This corner can be seen from the road.

content.description: Begin at an obvious finger-sized crack that splits the face at its highest point.  Climb crack to the top.  A lower slabs classic.
content.protection: Trad.  No bolts but anchors at the top.

content.description: Climb the crack a few feet to the right of For Slab Rats Only, with two trees growing out of the crack. It is fun moves, but its rather licheny and dirty.
content.protection: Standard Seneca rack, but no large stuff needed.
content.location: Parallels For Slab Rats Only on the detached wall you encounter before you reach the main wall at Lower Slabs. The top is the same as For Slab Rats Only, and puts you a few steps away from the start for Discrepancy and neighboring routes.

climbs.name: Death by Abunga
climbs.fa: Paul Gillispie, Chris Guenther, Topper Wilso 1983

content.description: Climb the face to the top.
content.location: Begin 8 ft. left of the obvious SCUTTLE crack.

content.description: Climb the right-facing corner to a larger right-facing corner.  From the top of the second corner traverse up and right under roofs to a pine tree at the top.
content.protection: The protection is difficult and the rock is bad.
content.location: Begin about 80 ft. right of the huge right-facing corner, at the small alcove which becomes a right-facing corner.

climbs.name: Captain Hook
climbs.fa: Paul Anikis, Cal Swoager, Eric Thesing, Mark Thesing

content.description: Move up the face to a right-facing corner and flake system.  Pull over the small overhang and then up to the top.
content.protection: The flake is hollow.  Take a skyhook.
content.location: Start from a ledge 20 ft. left of SENECA SAMURAI..

content.description: This is a really fun route to the left of Scuttle.  Easier face climbing through the opening moves to some small crack features with a few big moves on thin feet (crux), and then on to easier ground for the finish.
content.protection: This route can be lead with a set of nuts and a single set of cams to 2".  There is a great #4 stopper placement in the finger lock going into the crux.  This route is also easy to set up on TR.
content.location: The route is climber's left and uphill of Scuttle.  Look for the thin seam about 1/2 way up the rock with some finger pods here and there.

content.description: Climb the steep face and the right edge to the top.  Thin, balancy face/slabby type climbing.
content.protection: Some old fixed gear that needs replacing...maybe some thing wires besides those.  Can be TRed but you probably need some gear for the anchor.
content.location: On the lower section of wall where For Slab Rats Only is located, find the steep clean face on the far right side of that section.

climbs.name: And God Created All Men Equal

content.description: Climb the large, inside right-facing corner to the large overhang.  Using horizontal cracks, pull the center of the roof.  The roof is a small body length.  Continue up a loose, easy, unprotected face to the top.
content.location: Start underneath the largest roof, just right of GOOD MORNING.

content.description: Climb the shallow right-facing corner to an undercling.  Climb left and up a short left-facing corner.  From the top of the corner, move up and right toward a pine tree and the belay.
content.protection: Take a skyhook.
content.location: Use the same start as SNAKEBITE.
